result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Dquntae Jherquil Brigance in court.  Attorney McKenna Quinter on behalf of Natalie Probst in court for Dquntae Jherquil Brigance.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense does have discovery but needs time to review it. Defense is seeking to be heard on the bond modification that was filed. Asking for a bond modification to allow Defendant to drive. 
BTC: Cash bond conditions modified in case 22CT172. Matter set over.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Do not drive unless properly licensed. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:12 PM Defendant Dquntae Jherquil Brigance appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter appeared by video for Dquntae Jherquil Brigance.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
